alert.note: Alert for Tazewell; Woodford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 07 at 2:29AM CDT until May 07 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CDT FOR WEST CENTRAL WOODFORD AND NORTHEASTERN TAZEWELL COUNTIES... At 228 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Germantown Hills, or 7 miles northwest of Eureka, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Eureka around 240 AM CDT. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Lincoln. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
